q: Can you really launch in one week?
a: Absolutely. We focus on the pages that move the needle, show progress daily, and hit go by the weekend.

q: What kinds of websites fit a 7‑day sprint?
a:
Best fits:
• Launch landing page or homepage with 3–6 sections (hero, proof, features, pricing/CTA, FAQ, contact)
• Portfolio with 6–12 projects using a simple CMS for fast publishing
• Product/marketing site with 1–3 pages that tell a clear story
• Light integrations: analytics, forms, basic calendar embeds, simple CMS, SEO metadata & OG images

Not a fit in one week:
• Complex web apps or dashboards
• Large e‑commerce catalogs (a single product checkout or Stripe link is OK; full catalog is not)
• Heavy custom backends, SSO, multi‑tenant systems
• Full brand identity from scratch (we can do lightweight direction; deep identity takes longer)

What to expect:
• Senior craft, tasteful motion, accessibility, and performance baked in
• A focused scope with depth on the primary page(s)
• A small system (tokens/components) you can extend in future sprints
Your goal, audience, must‑have pages, and any brand bits. Messy notes welcome — we’ll tidy the story.

q: Is this friendly on startup budgets?
a: Yep. Small senior team + tight process = more wow per dollar. No agency bloat here.
You got it. Analytics, forms, payments, and a CMS so you can publish without pinging engineering.
Keep the momentum with monthly sprints, or call us in for quick wins whenever you like.
